txt.en:
'I must admit, I've no idea what these odd markings mean. But there is a young Lossoth, an apprentice seer of some sort, apparently -- näkijä is what they call them -- who might know something.

'Mika has been on some sort of quest down in that mammoth graveyard, Norsu-hauta, just south of here.

'Would you go there and ask him about the markings.'
'What do you bring me? Let me see. Where did you come by this tusk?'
'Go talk to the Lossoth-boy! I'm no help if you are curious about the markings on that tusk. Now, if you want to learn about spear-making, I'm your dwarf....'

Sigrík has let you borrow the tusk you found for him, with the mysterious markings on it. He suggested that a Lossoth näkijä's apprentice by the name of Mika, who lives in Norsu-hauta, might know what to make of them.
Mika is at Norsu-hauta, south of Zigilgund.\n\nSigrík has asked you to speak with the young näkijä Mika about the markings on the mammoth tusk you collected for him.
